Record_string.unknown_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

AutoAcceptProof.description: Typing of the state for auto acceptance

HandshakeProtocol.description:
Enum values should be sorted based on order of preference. Values will be
included in this order when creating out of band invitations.

Pick_JwsGeneralFormat.Exclude_keyofJwsGe.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_JwsGeneralFormat.payload_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

AttachmentData.description: A JSON object that gives access to the actual content of the attachment

base64.description: Base64-encoded data, when representing arbitrary content inline instead of via links. Optional.

json.description: Directly embedded JSON data, when representing content inline instead of via links, and when the content is natively conveyable as JSON. Optional.

links.description: A list of zero or more locations at which the content may be fetched. Optional.

jws.description: A JSON Web Signature over the content of the attachment. Optional.

sha256.description: The hash of the content. Optional.

description.description: An optional human-readable description of the content.

filename.description: A hint about the name that might be used if this attachment is persisted as a file. It is not required, and need not be unique. If this field is present and mime-type is not, the extension on the filename may be used to infer a MIME type.

mimeType.description: Describes the MIME type of the attached content. Optional but recommended.

lastmodTime.description: A hint about when the content in this attachment was last modified.

byteCount.description: Optional, and mostly relevant when content is included by reference instead of by value. Lets the receiver guess how expensive it will be, in time, bandwidth, and storage, to fully fetch the attachment.

proofType.description:
The proofType to be used for signing the credential.

Must be a valid Linked Data Signature suite.

verificationMethod.description:
URI of the verificationMethod to be used for signing the credential.

Must be a valid did url pointing to a key.

method, so it's an empty object

This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.acceptRequest. No options are available for this
method, so it's an empty object

JsonLdAcceptRequestFormat.description:
Format for accepting a jsonld credential request. Optionally allows the verification
method to use to sign the credential.

CredentialFormatDataMessagePayload__40_L.description:
Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the cred abstract format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#cred-abstract-format

Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the cred abstract format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#cred-abstract-format

Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the cred abstract format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#cred-abstract-format

Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the cred abstract format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#cred-abstract-format

GetCredentialFormatDataReturn__40_Legacy.description: Get format data return value. Each key holds a mapping of credential format key to format data.

info.title: credo-controller
info.description: Rest endpoint wrapper for using your agent over HTTP

get.description: Retrieve all proof records
Retrieve proof record by proof record id

post.description:
Initiate a new presentation exchange as prover by sending a presentation proposal request
to the connection with the specified connection id.

Accept a presentation proposal as verifier by sending an accept proposal message
to the connection associated with the proof record.
Creates a presentation request bound to existing connection
Creates a presentation request not bound to any proposal or existing connection

Accept a presentation request as prover by sending an accept request message
to the connection associated with the proof record.

Accept a presentation as prover by sending an accept presentation message
to the connection associated with the proof record.

get.description: Return proofRecord

post.description: Create Secp256k1 key pair for polygon DID
Create polygon based W3C schema
Estimate transaction

get.description: Fetch schema details
Retrieve all out of band records
Retrieve an out of band record by id

delete.description: Deletes an out of band record from the repository.

post.description:
Creates an outbound out-of-band record containing out-of-band invitation message defined in
Aries RFC 0434: Out-of-Band Protocol 1.1.

requestBody.description: configuration of how out-of-band invitation should be created

schema.description: configuration of how out-of-band invitation should be created

post.description:
Creates an outbound out-of-band record in the same way how `createInvitation` method does it,
but it also converts out-of-band invitation message to an "legacy" invitation message defined
in RFC 0160: Connection Protocol and returns it together with out-of-band record.

requestBody.description: configuration of how a invitation should be created

schema.description: configuration of how a invitation should be created

post.description: Creates a new connectionless legacy invitation.

requestBody.description: configuration of how a connection invitation should be created

schema.description: configuration of how a connection invitation should be created

200.description: out-of-band record and connection record if one has been created.

post.description:
Creates inbound out-of-band record and assigns out-of-band invitation message to it if the
message is valid.

200.description: out-of-band record and connection record if one has been created.

post.description:
Creates inbound out-of-band record and assigns out-of-band invitation message to it if the
message is valid.

Accept a connection invitation as invitee (by sending a connection request message) for the connection with the specified connection id.
This is not needed when auto accepting of connections is enabled.

get.description: Retrieve question and answer records by query

post.description: Send a question to a connection
Send a answer to question

get.description: Retrieve question answer record by id
Retrieve basic messages by connection id

post.description: Send a basic message to a connection

200.description: isValidSignature - true if signature is valid, false otherwise

post.description: Verify data using a key

requestBody.description:
Verify options
data - Data has to be in base64 format
publicKeyBase58 - Public key in base58 format
signature - Signature in base64 format

schema.description:
Verify options
data - Data has to be in base64 format
publicKeyBase58 - Public key in base58 format
signature - Signature in base64 format

get.description: Resolves did and returns did resolution result

post.description: Did nym registration

get.description: Get schema by schemaId

post.description: Create schema

get.description: Retrieve credential definition by credential definition id

post.description: Creates a new credential definition.

get.description: Retrieve all credential exchange records
Retrieve credential exchange record by credential record id

post.description:
Initiate a new credential exchange as holder by sending a propose credential message
to the connection with a specified connection id.

Accept a credential proposal as issuer by sending an accept proposal message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Initiate a new credential exchange as issuer by creating a credential offer
without specifying a connection id

Accept a credential offer as holder by sending an accept offer message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Accept a credential request as issuer by sending an accept request message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Accept a credential as holder by sending an accept credential message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

get.description: Return credentialRecord
Retrieve all connections records
Retrieve connection record by connection id

delete.description: Deletes a connection record from the connection repository.

post.description:
Accept a connection request as inviter by sending a connection response message
for the connection with the specified connection id.

This is not needed when auto accepting of connection is enabled.

Accept a connection response as invitee by sending a trust ping message
for the connection with the specified connection id.

This is not needed when auto accepting of connection is enabled.

get.description: Retrieve basic messages by connection id

post.description: Send a basic message to a connection

Retrieve question and answer records by query

post.description: Send a question to a connection
Send a answer to question
